Cause you promissed, to love me forever
And you told me, we'll always be dancing together,
But now I dance alone, I dance alone
I dance alone!

Midnight Train,
take me away !
Midnight Train,
just find a place for me to stay !
Midnight Train,
I'm leaving just the way I came
Take me away from all this pain,

You never really stop loving someone, you just try to live w

Love…
Love is a deadly sweet poison.
Love is joy, somewhere there… in the chest.
Love is an Angel in a beautiful sculpture. Frozen.
Or a Devil, but very seductive dressed.
Love is sleepless nights in a bed of alluring flowers,
Love is the spring inside, with the bittersweet flavors.
Love is the sorrow written in poems by restless authors.
Love is a fabulous drawing of nonexistent colors.
Love is flowers, heat, painless touches of sun,
Eyes closed, warm rain crying over the town,
Love is power, lordship, inescapable domination,
Love is obedience, respect and self-dedication…
Love is a pain for the soul, silent wounds on the heart,
Loud screams from the inside. Prayers. Sins. Love is an art.
Love is freedom, or a prison of all existing feelings,
Love is sometimes slow, sometimes too fast heart beatings.
Love is strange, overcast days. It’s an unbelievable reality,
It’s when you think that dreams are real. Lies. Love is duty,
Memories that last forever, sweet kisses, hugs that in a moment die,
Unspoken words, secret desires, fear and dying butterflies.
Mysterious glances, mysterious gestures, mysterious words,
Mysterious smiles. Unbearable mystery, mystery hurts.
Love unusual creates, but also unusual destroys
Winged destinies, dreams and yesterday’s hopes…
Love is the question without any reasonable answers,
It’s the answer to the questions of incurable dreamers.
Love is when you miss with all your being, but you’re not missed,
When you suffer in silence, remembering when you kissed.
Love is a burning Hell inside the peaceful Heaven,
Love is dark days, bright nights. It’s when you’re fallen.
When you’re lost in a drunken flight, you touch the sky,
When you painfully hit the ground and when you cry.
Love is coldness, no matter how hard you try to warm up,
Love is forgotten happiness in the morning, in a coffee cup.
Love is a game which you don’t know how to play,
Sometimes you win, but usually lose. Love is an unknown way.
Love is a gun to the temple, plumb mixed with blood,
Irreparable mistakes, decision, you give up on being proud.
You won’t forget what you did for love…Will you forget
All the stupid things you did? When you were always upset?
Love is a flower that grows quickly in your inside,
But when the flower is wilting it takes all your pride.
Love is a battle with yourself, when you’re fighting for life.
Love is a bleeding heart that was implanted with a knife.
Love is trembling, crawling under your soft skin,
Stealing your life, your innocence, leaving you with its sin.
Love’s dancing with the Devil, you dare to look him in the eyes,
Believing he’s an Angel, believing in his lies.
You know what is love, no need to write anymore,
Just look inside you. Whom do you think about after all?
Who made you feel something that you never felt?
Who made you feel happy? Who made you feel sad?
Who did for you something that no one ever did?
Who wiped your tears and kissed gently your eyelid?
If you think of someone after all you read above,
I assure you, that person is your Love…

Is life so it?

.............Triangle......................
Jack loves Jane but Jane loves Joe
But how could she ever let Jack go
It’s obvious everyone can see
The trouble with this trilogy
Hearts don’t come…
In sets of three So what do they do now?
There’s only one way to find out
It’s time to pick your prize and
It better be right, it better be right
This triangle has
To untangle
Got to let it go
This triangle is
Too much to handle
Got to let it go
Jane loves Joe, but Joe’s with Jill
But Jane wants to be with Joe still
It’s bad enough it breaks Jack’s heart
It’s tearing their whole world apart
But how do you stop
When it’s gone so far

Yesterday, today, tomorrow
Fade away like frozen photographs.
Remember, forget
The stakes, the ways you take,
The ways you make the moments pass.
For every regret,
I tell a beautiful lie.
And I would die if you find out.
I tell a beautiful lie every time that I
Did not open up my mouth.
All the same, it’s a game,
It’s a play, it’s a war,
It’s a shame that we’re always fighting for.
I don’t mean to cast no blame,
I don’t intend to pretend that
I could never loved you more.
But in the blink of an eye,
Everything you ever knew can change
And it’s a beautiful lie if you think
Everything will always stay the same.

Babe. My babe.
You got a secret – it’s starting to show.
My babe. Sweet babe.
How long can you keep it?
How far would you go?
You tell a beautiful lie.
You tell a beautiful lie.
And it’s going to, it’s going to drive you crazy.
